wikipedia_page.main: Geraldine Thomson Mucha (5 July 1917 – 12 October 2012) was a Scottish composer.She was born in London and studied at the Royal Academy of Music. She married the Czech writer Jiří Mucha, son of the painter Alphonse Mucha, and in 1945 moved to Prague. She lived there for the greater part of the next sixty years.

response: *Geraldine Mucha (1917–2012): Four string quartets between 1941 and 1988.

Farjeon left the Royal Academy of Music in 1900, but in 1901 he returned to teach composition. Two years later, at the age of 25, he became the Academy's youngest ever professor, having become the family wage-earner after the death of his father. Among his pupils were Mary Chandler, George Lloyd, Christian Darnton, Geraldine Mucha, Phyllis Tate, Daniel Jones and Steve Race. He also taught at the Blackheath Conservatoire.

response: *12 October 2012: Prague Society honors the passing of Geraldine Mucha.

Goodson's recording of contemporary piano music, Strange Attractors,Strange Attractors webpage at Albany Records website features works by John Harbison, Martin Herman, Stephen Jaffe,  Robert Kyr, Augusta Read Thomas and Randall Woolf. She has also recorded a 4-disc set of the complete solo piano music of Czech composer Josef Bohuslav Foerster, titled Foerster: Dreams, Memories and Impressions.Foerster: Dreams, Memories and Impressions webpage at Brilliant Classics website Other recordings include works by Scottish-Czech composer Geraldine Mucha, her Concerto for Piano (1960) and Variations on an Old Scottish Song (1954), both on an ArcoDiva label release.Mucha: Macbeth & Other Orchestral Works / Weiser, Hradec Kralove Philharmonic webpage at ArkivMusic websiteMACBETH and Other Orchestral Works by Geraldine Mucha webpage at ArcoDiva label website Goodson's pianism also appears on a Rattle Records label release titled Shadows Crossing Water,Shadows Crossing Water webpage at Rattle Records website featuring works by New Zealand composer Dame Gillian Whitehead.  In addition, Goodson has recorded numerous works for Czech Radio including pieces by Vlastislav Matoušek, Hanuš Bartoň, Josef Adamek and others.

Goodson graduated from Duke University with a degree in music, and from the Peabody Conservatory with a Master of Music in piano performance. She is on the piano faculty of New York University in Prague,New York University faculty webpage and until 2017 served as co-founder and co-director of the Geraldine Mucha musical archive."Remembering Geraldine Mucha," Radio Praha website, 27-Oct-2012
